title: How to Awaken a Monster in Summoner's War

steps.headline: Clear Kabir Ruins.
steps.description: If you have not finished all seven levels in Normal Mode in Kabir Ruins, then Cairos Dungeon will not be open to you, which, as you will find out, is a necessity.

steps.headline: Pick a monster to awaken.
steps.description: Make sure that the monster you have chosen isn't already awakened (where the stars by their name will be purple) or their stars are silver, which means that they can't be awakened. These silver-star monsters are mostly just used for power-up material.

steps.headline: Enter Cairos Dungeon.
steps.description: You can do this by tapping on the logo for it once.

steps.headline: Scroll down at the list of dungeons.
steps.description: Keep clicking until you find the certain Hall of Element/Magic you need to gain more essences. The Hall of Elements all open on certain days only. For example, on a Monday, you cannot go hunting for wind essences, as the only Element Hall that's open on Monday is the Dark Hall.

steps.headline: Tap.
steps.description: When you find the dungeon that you want to go through, tap on the icon for it once. This will bring the preparation screen, where you can prepare your team, look at the boss's stats, or even bring a friend's rep with you.

steps.headline: Clear the floor.
steps.description: Once you defeat the boss of that floor, you will be rewarded with essences.

steps.headline: Repeat the prior step until you have enough essences to awaken that monster.
Go back to the monster you wish to awaken.
steps.description: Tap the awaken tab and hit the "Awaken" button in the bottom right corner of the screen. You will get a pop-up that says "Your monster will undergo a unique transformation. Are you sure you want to awaken?" This is to prevent players who accidentally tap the Awaken button from awakening the wrong monster. Hit Yes if it's the right monster.

steps.headline: Watch the cutscene where your monster awakens.
steps.description: At the end of it, it should show your newly awakened monster and its awakened name at the bottom.

steps.headline: Finished.
steps.description: You have now awakened your monster!
